org.trianacode.gui.util

Class Env

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trianacode.gui.util.Env

  • public final class Env
extends java.lang.Object
    Env allows a way of accessing various environment and system variables within Triana. Some methods convert from the Java system properties to suitable labels which are of more use within Triana. To get the particular variable you want just call any of these functions from within any unit e.g. :-

    Env.trianahome()

    returns triana's getApplicationDataDir directory.

    The toString() method is also useful for identifying all the system properties at run-time to make sure your system is set up correctly. This message is printed out Triana or Triana is used.

      • setUserProperty

        public static java.lang.Object setUserProperty(java.lang.String propName,
                               java.lang.Object propValue)
        Adds a name, value pair to the user configuration properties. The propValue object has to correctly override the equals() method otherwise the property file will be written every time this method is called, even if the new value is supposed to be the same as the old value.
        Returns:
        the old value or null if there was none.

      • separator

        public static final java.lang.String separator()

      • os

        public static final java.lang.String os()
        Returns the machines operating system. This returns a single word which identifies the particular operating system. The identifier is returned in lower case so it can be used to identify directories of where various things are stored for different platforms e.g.

        1. Windows 95/NT - windows is returned
        2. Solaris - solaris is returned
        3. IRIX - irix is returned
        4. DEC - dec is returned
        5. LINUX - linux is returned

      • getEndian

        public int getEndian()

      • getSharedLibSuffix

        public static final java.lang.String getSharedLibSuffix()
        The ending for the native libraries i.e. .so on unix and .dll on window 95/NT, .jnilib for Mac OS X

      • getSharedLibPrefix

        public static final java.lang.String getSharedLibPrefix()
        The prefix for native libraries, nothing for windows, lib for *nix systems.

      • getSharedLibPath

        public static final java.lang.String getSharedLibPath()
        Triana's platform specific directory for native shared libraries.

      • getPluginDir

        public static final java.lang.String getPluginDir()
        Returns the location of the plugin directory used to store project specific plugins to be loaded at run time, for example filters and import/export tools.
        Returns:
        the plugin directory location

      • arch

        public static final java.lang.String arch()
        Returns the machine architecture. This returns a single word which identifies the particular platform e.g.

        1. Windows 95/NT - Windows is returned
        2. Solaris - Solaris is returned
        3. IRIX - Irix is returned
        4. DEC - Dec is returned
        5. LINUX - Linux is returned

        public static final java.lang.String osVer()
